data.title: the best chinese in town
data.text: the food is the best from their lunch specials to dinner for 6. service is top notch friendly.ive tried all Chinese in town & id say N China is the place.

data.title: Dinner for 2
data.text: Ordered the dinner for 2 on the menu. ..could gave fed 4 easily.  Food was served hot and delicious! !  Soup and pot stickers were superior!!

data.title: Wonderful restaurant
data.text: We had to wait a bit after ordering but the place was full. The food was beautifully presented; the staff very friendly. Each of our 7 family members exclaimed how delicious their food was, whether vegetarian or regular appetite. I would say it is some of the best Chinese food I have had in a long time. We are from WA and we would definitely eat here again.

data.title: Best Chinese in town
data.text: This restaurant has been a favorite for 30 years. The food and service in that time has never changed.  Food and service have been excellent for 30 years. It is family operated by 2 generations.  We have never had a bad meal. Lunch has great choices for good price.  Dinners have abundant choices available all day.

data.title: Great Lunch specials
data.text: Great lunch specials, this is a regular spot for are family to have both lunches and dinner. They have the best hot and sour soup that I have ever had. If you like your meals a bit more spicy you can let them know and they will add extra peppers to spice it up for you or if you don't like your Kung Po chicken not so spicy just let them know and they can tame it down for you as well. The waitress's are very courteous, friendly and helpful. If you need advice on what is best they have their personal favorites they will steer you to. I have several now favorites that I found this way.

data.title: Great food.
data.text: North China serves the best chinese food in the area.  Whenever been disappointed and there's always lots to take home to enjoy the next day.

data.title: Delicious food - huge portions!
data.text: Lovely restaurant - laid back feeling with a good choice on the menu.  Portions are a little large so might want to share these rather than have your own as you might not manage a whole portion.

data.title: Best Chinese Hands Down
data.text: Love this place! Not only is the food over the top fantastic, but the staff is amazing, friendly, and efficient. Always feel welcome when we eat here. And EVERYTHING is phenomenal!

data.title: Wow!!
data.text: Awesome Chinese food with prompt, courteous service. Have been there several times now and wish there was one closer to where I live. Take out and left overs - yes!!!

data.title: RIBS!!!
data.text: Do NOT leave without trying the ribs. The effect is an almost candied sauce. To die for! My husband has been coming here for 35 years. Thats a testimony in and of itself.

data.title: Tasty food, great staff
data.text: I had a pick up order.  Food was tasty and in good quantity.  Staff was friendly and very helpful.  I will go there again.

data.title: Definitely not for vegetarians
data.text: My wife and I were eager to try this restaurant since it had glowing reviews. We were looking for a quick lunch so decided to give it a try. I do not eat meat although seafood is in my diet. Their lunch specials came with soup,a spring roll and pot sticker. Only one of the lunch special selections was vegetarian but all of the add-ons included meat. My wife being a meat eater chose a lunch special. I ordered off the menu and ordered a soup for a starter. The soup - tofu and spinach - was truly unappetizing. The tofu was raw and was floating in a soup that had no more taste than weak salty hot water. A couple of strands of spinach floated in it but only added color. My Kung Pao Tofu main dish which was advertised as being spicy was quite bland. It was quite dry and came so fast it seemed like it had been waiting around for a while until somebody ordered it. My wife who lived in Taiwan for a couple of years found her meal to be edible but disappointing. With other Chinese restaurants in the area we almost certainly will not be returning to this one.

data.title: Best Chinese Food Around
data.text: Right to the point; I've been coming here since I was a little girl, and my family and I do not eat Chinese food from anywhere else other than here. My family that visits from L.A. do not leave Santa Maria without stopping and eating here first. Never disappoints. Thank you to the owners for all these years and never changing a thing!

data.title: Great Chinese Food.
data.text: We eat at this restaurant very often. Original Chinese Food that tastes great with a variety of dinners on the menu.

data.title: Hidden Gem
data.text:
We've lived in Santa Maria for a long time and somehow just found out about North China. Every meal we've had here is fantastic. The food is fresh, the flavors are amazing, and we have never been disappointed. 
The service is very fast and friendly. It's definitely one of our go to places for dinner and some of the best Chinese food I've ever had.

data.title: Best Chinese in Santa Maria
data.text: Excellent, spicy, quickly prepared Chinese food was found at the North China. Our servers did a fantastic job of keeping our glasses full, checking to see that everything was all right without being overbearing. Yes, the price could be a bit high but you get what you pay for.  I strongly recommend the Mongolian beef, it was outstanding. Take a chance on this place and you won't regret it.  Santa Maria is not known as having great Chinese food but this restaurant really does a great job.

data.title: Overwhelmed with Deliciousness
data.text: So many plugs by regulars got us to finally try this modest looking spot, and we are so glad we finally did.  Warm welcome, charming atmosphere, packed house and all on a Tuesday night.  The owner greeted us and apologized when we had to wait a whole 5 minutes for a table.  Waitresses hustled and food was served promptly.  And what delicious food!  We got the combo for 2 and was offered a little flexibility on entrees.  Partner chose hot n sour soup and loved it.  Everything was wonderful.  Definitely will go back.  Great discovery we should have made years ago.

data.title: Good service, clean, ok food but a little pricey
data.text:
I went there for two people. The service was exceptionally good, the waitresses kept asking if you need anything, or take your order, one after others. I think they do not have a waitress per table, but rather whoever not busy, would attend customer. Not to mention the waitress are young and pretty. 

The food was ok. I would say it's typical American Chinese food. The portions were large. We ordered 2 dishes for 2 person, but could finish them. They charged for rice as well as soup. Expected ~$50 for 2 person.

If you really really want Chinese food and cannot wait else where, I would recommend. I would think the food would be consistent if you like the taste there. It is clean, and service are excellent, for that I added one star.

data.title: Overseasoned, underwhelming.
data.text: I have tried this restaurant several times and remain unimpressed. Recently my wife asked for Chinese food as her lunch choice. Since we were in town, I suggested North China. She ordered Sesame Chicken and I ordered the equivalent of Beef in Spicy Garlic Sauce, a common Chinese entre. Hers was way over seasoned as was mine with none of the subtleness that I have come to expect from well prepared Chinese food. The Sesame Chicken was like none she had ever tasted and I don't mean that in a good way. Mine simply was not spicy and was without a hint of garlic. I have heard this place described as American-Chinese food and I think that is the problem. Some of these dishes hit you over the head. I find the food at Magic Dragon to be miles ahead and very consistent. I love Chinese food so much I hate to give less than a good review but even the Hot and Sour soup has lacked the delicate balance that this dish requires, as though an important ingredient had been left out. Locals seem to love this place though and numerous People's Choice awards adorn the walls. I should add that the service is always faultless in all my visits. I just don't get it.

data.title: Delicious Chinese Food
data.text: In my opinion North China had the best Chinese food in Santa Maria. Their portions are generous. Their food is always fresh and delicious.  It's always served hot and with a smile.  Love this place and highly recommend it to anyone wanting a great meal.
